intro: Deiregyne hio, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Deiregyne hio is often found in coastal and lowland areas, contributing to the unique flora of Hawaii.
